data.title: Modifies IMove & Enter and Fixes #4640 - Units teleport into transports
data.body:
Adds more support for enter/exit/dock logic.
Fixes #4640 - Units teleport into transports.

data.title: Revert "Polishing/normalizing new GUI"
data.body: #6518 edited the chrome.png file directly, which has caused it to diverge from the source artwork and has made the radar bin background appear blurry.

data.title: Prevent player name from becoming part of a formatting string.
data.body:
This fixes #6524 

I've found 3 occasions where the player name was allowed to become part of the formatting string.

data.title: Game crashes when (any) player uses an name with {} in it and surrenders
data.body:
This happened with a trol on a multiplayer game on release-20140722 but its still here on BLEED. You can crash yourself and all other players in a game when your name is something like "{bla}haha" 

As soon as the player with the {} in his name does surrender, all players crash. Its even reproduceable with a replay.

```
Exception of type `System.FormatException`: Input string was not in a correct format.

data.title: Add supplimentary IO stream checks
data.body:
Someone has reported a crash in the IRC channel in relation with this function. while overviewing this function i had noticed, that there a no checks before the read progress starts ("canRead" and "is null") 

```

Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34014
Exception of type `System.IO.EndOfStreamException`: Es wurde versucht, über das Ende des Datenstroms hinaus zu lesen.

   bei OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.Mount(String name, String annotation)
   bei OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.LoadFromManifest(Manifest manifest)
   bei OpenRA.ModData.PrepareMap(String uid)

Added supplimentary IO stream checks

data.title: Repaired Trainingcamp map
Polishing/normalizing new GUI
data.body:
I see that a lot of work was made to do this new gui, which is excellent to me

my effort was to only high-ending cosmetic things
- normalize faction logo
- correct game clock centering
- stylize negative power values with red

data.title: Duplicate units crate action creates stuck units
data.body:
Not only is it weird that a bunch of units beam into the world from a crate several cells away, it also creates stuck units:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/4345307/c0f7790a-40c5-11e4-835a-85009099cb5c.png)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4508202-duplicate-units-crate-action-creates-stuck-units?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Moves LimitedAmmo and Reloads functionality to Armament
data.body:
Mostly done.

Some notes as of 2014-10-07 00:50 CMT+1:
- HackyAI needs a limited ammo and Reloads check, but I couldn't get my head around on how to implement them in this particular case
- I have no idea whether my changes to `AirStates` and `FlyAttack`/`HeliAttack` really work as intended (though the two attacks seem to work fine)
- Minelayer reloading seems to work without the `Rearm` activity, so the related stuff in `Rearm` is probably redundant

Closes #2840 once finished.

data.title: Update third party Windows DLLs
data.body:
http://kcat.strangesoft.net/openal-soft-1.16.0-bin.zip

Fixes #6508

data.title: Include map-players in the color validation checks.
data.body: Closes #6445.

data.title: Creation of Mods.Common.
data.body:
Create Mods.Common Project and Update Mods.RA CNC TS and D2K to use it.

This is just a small stub of what It can be.

data.title: Move inaccuracy modifier queries outside the projectile ctors.
data.body: Fixes #6449.

data.title: Add libgit2sharp functionality to Utility for revisioned mod installation
data.body:
Needs libraries for linux/windows before merge (and referenced dylib rename in source of libgit2sharp?).

Git repo name must contain `oramod-`<modname>.
No better way to update right now than deletion and recloning.

Functionality tested with:
    `$` `mono OpenRA.Utility.exe --git-mod-install https://github.com/Phrohdoh/oramod-warfair`
    (though the actual mod is broken)

Also pinging @scskwirl; this is the thing I was working on that will make testing Warfair easier.

data.title: OpenAL crash on Windows 8.1 64 bit
data.body:
https://gist.github.com/steelphase/2fc593c7f6d7d0dce529

Crash happens right before screen 

looks to be related to soft_oal.dll, and maybe related to Windows 8.1 64bit and sound drivers.
I grabbed a newer version of soft_oal from http://kcat.strangesoft.net/openal.html#download
and was able to alleviate the problem.

Don't know if anyone else is running into this.

data.title: Improved ore rendering
data.body:
Originally I wanted to fix #6278 but I can’t reproduce the bug. I set all ore to the lowest density and mining it worked flawlessly.

But I fixed some other problems with ore drawing:
• The sprite for the highest possible density was never used.
• Added rounding to the ore density linear interpolation (old: 4.9 => 4.0 new: 4.9 => 5.0)

data.title: Allow canceling beacons with right click
data.body: In order to fix #6237 .

data.title: Remove beacons when the badgers get shot down
data.body:
Done as suggested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6497#issuecomment-56092420 .

Would fix #6184 .

PS: Sorry for the new PR, but I can't reopen the old one.

data.title: Implementing search feature in map choosers
data.body:
ref #6374
I've implemented this filter. It looks that it integrates with whole code without disturbing any coherency.. Please share me any thoughts.

My objection in MapChooserLogic.cs:91

```
.Where(m => m.Type == gameMode || gameMode == null)
```

-> the null check was at right (left side is being checked first in logical alternative) so I've moved it to left, and checked this null case - its handling it right now.

![map_filter](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6244620/4330726/abf58270-3fb4-11e4-8a9f-6db42deacb5e.gif)

![mapfiltercnc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6244620/4330727/abf8eb5e-3fb4-11e4-8c03-9dcef459d71c.png)

data.title: Turrets now realign by default
data.body:
After using vehicles to fire for the first time, their turret persistently stayed at the angle they fired at no matter which direction they navigate, you couldn't set up tanks to face a certain way because the turret would always face in the set direction and it plain looked weird.

Default AlignWhenIdle = true means:

When the unit destroys a target, it's turret remains facing so it's ready to fire on the next wave.
When ordered to move and the previous target was destroyed, the turret realigns.
When ordered the 'stop' command, the turret realigns - good visual feedback
Doesn't affect turreted structures

data.title: GACNST - increase the size of the selection box
data.body:
This PR fixes the selection box size on GACNST
- Increase the size of the selection box to "120, 90"
- Adjust the offset so that the building in the middle of the box

-> the null check was at right (left side is being checked first in logical alternative) so I've moved it to left, and checked this null case - its handling it right now.

data.title: Added basic list of Civilian Buildings from TS
data.body:
- The Building IDs are sortet from A up to Z ;)
- Names are taken from Rules.ini (TS)
- This PR contains as far i had found the Base list of Civilian Buildings with there Names
- They are based on the Civilian Template which is defind under "defaults.yaml" throuth another PR
- Fine tune (size, armor squences) have to be added later...
